solution:
16 eggs per day.
3 eggs for breakfast.
4 eggs for muffins.
She sells the remaining 9 eggs at the farmers' market for $2 a piece.
This means she makes 9 * $2 = $18 per day at the farmers' market.
The answer is 18.

The robe takes 2 bolts of blue fiber and half that much white fiber.
This means the total number of bolts is: 2 + (2 * 0.5) = 2 + 1 = 3 bolts.
The answer is 3.

He bought a house for 80,000.
He spent 50,000 on repairs.
Now the value of the house is 150% of the original price, which is 80,000 * 1.5 = 120,000.
He sold it for 120,000, so his profit was 120,000 - 80,000 = 40,000.
The answer is 40,000.

He runs 3 sprints 3 times a week.
60 meters each sprint, so total meters he runs is 3 * 3 * 60 = 540 meters.
The answer is 540 meters.

In the morning, Wendi gives her chickens 15 cups of feed.
In the afternoon, she gives her chickens another 25 cups of feed.
In total, she gives her chickens 15 + 25 = 40 cups of feed.
The size of Wendi's flock is 20 chickens.
Each chicken gets 3 cups of feed.
So the number of cups of feed she needs to give in the final meal is 20 * 3 = 60 cups.
The answer is 60.

He needs to pay 16 * $5 = $80 for the 16 glasses.
The question is how much money he has left after that.
$80 is the amount he has to pay, so after that he has $80 to spend on whatever else he wants.
The answer is $80.

Seattle has 20 sheep.
Charleston has 4 times as many sheep as Seattle.
So Charleston must have 20 * 4 = 80 sheep.
Toulouse has twice as many sheep as Charleston.
So Toulouse must have 80 * 2 = 160 sheep.
The answer is 160.

Carla is downloading 200 GB.
Normally she can download 2 GB/minute, so the total time is 200 / 2 = 100 minutes.
Then Windows forces a restart to install updates, which takes 20 minutes.
After this she has to restart the download from the beginning.
So, the time taken after the restart is 100 + 20 = 120 minutes.
The answer is 120.

He initially has 3 hours to drive.
He spends the first 2 hours in standstill traffic.
He spends the next half-hour driving at a speed of 30mph, before being able to drive the remaining time of the 4 hours going at 80 mph.
He spends the next half-hour driving at a speed of 30mph.
He spends the remaining time of the 4 hours going at 80 mph.
So he spends 2 + 30 + 30 + 80 = 150 minutes.
The answer is 8.

Rate per hour for the first 40 hours she works each week is $10.
She also receives an overtime pay of 1.2 times her regular hourly rate.
She worked 45 hours this week.
So in total she must have been paid 45 * $10 = $450.
The answer is $450.

The number of downloads in the second month was three times as many as the downloads in the first month.
There were 60 downloads in the first month.
So, the number of downloads in the second month must have been 60 * 3 = 180 downloads.
But then, the number of downloads in the third month was reduced by 30%.
This means that 180 * 0.7 = 126 downloads.
The answer is 126.

Toula bought 3 dozen donuts which cost $68.
This means she spent 3 * $68 = $204 on donuts.
Then she bought 2 dozen mini cupcakes which cost $80.
That means she spent 2 * $80 = $160 on cupcakes.
Finally she bought 6 dozen mini cheesecakes which cost $55.
That means she spent 6 * $55 = $330 on cheesecakes.
In total, Toula spent $204 + $160 + $330 = $755.
The answer is $755.

He has to plant the tree first.
After that, the tree will grow 7 lemons every year.
Each lemon he can sell for $1.5.
So he can earn 7 * $1.5 = $11.5 every year after that.
But he has to spend $3 every year to water and feed the tree.
So he will earn 11.5 - 3 = $8.5.
He will earn $8.5 for every year after the tree is planted.
The answer is 8.5.

Initially, she had 5 vacuum cleaners.
On the green house, a third was sold. So after that, she has 5 - 3 = 2 vacuum cleaners.
On the red house, she sold 2 more, so now she has 2 - 2 = 0.
She has no vacuum cleaners left.
The answer is 5.

There are 20 students.
20 students enrolled in contemporary dance.
So, 20% of 20 is 4 students.
Of the remaining 16 students, 8 students enrolled in jazz dance.
So, 25% of 16 is 4 students.
The rest (8) enrolled in hip-hop dance.
So, the remaining (8) students enrolled in hip-hop dance, means that hip-hop dance enrolled 8 out of 20 students, or 40%.
The answer is 40%.
A list of more math riddles with answers can be found here.

We know that if the merchant buys the jewelry, he will make $5,000 at the end of the month.
If he buys electronic gadgets, he will make $8,000 at the end of the month.
So the profit is (8,000 - 5,000) = $3,000.
The answer is $3,000.

They both traveled 80 miles westward.
Then they traveled 150 miles northward, for a total of 80 + 150 = 210 miles.
The answer is 210.

She gets paid $20 per hour to teach and $30 for cheerleading coach.
This means she gets paid $35 per hour overall.
If she works 50 weeks a year, 35 hours a week as a teacher and 15 hours a week as a coach, that means she has worked 50 * 35 + 50 * 15 = 2550 hours overall.
She gets paid $35 per hour, so her annual salary is 2550 * $35 = $90000.
The answer is $90000.

Claire makes a 3 egg omelet every morning for breakfast.
Every morning she eats 3 eggs.
4 weeks have 4 * 7 = 28 days in total.
She only eats 3 eggs per day, so she eats 28 * 3 = 84 eggs in total.
The answer is 84.

The 4 miles are already done.
For the remaining distance, she has to walk 2 * 4 = 8 miles.
So, her average speed needs to be 8 / 2 = 4 miles per hour.
The answer is 4.

We have 15 liters of pineapple drink that is three fifths water.
And we have 10 liters of orange drink that is two thirds water.
That means we have 25 liters of water.
We have 1 liter of orange drink that we spilled.
So we have 24 liters of water in the remaining soda.
The answer is 24.

Samantha is 31 years old.
Raymond was born 6 years before Samantha.
So Raymond must have been born at age 31 - 6 = 25 years old.
Raymond's son was born when Raymond was 25 years old.
The answer is 25.

Billy has 8 customers on Tuesday.
His first 3 customers buy 1 DVD each.
His next 2 customers buy 2 DVDs each.
His last 3 customers don’t buy any DVDs.
His first 3 customers bought 3 DVDs.
His next 2 customers bought 4 DVDs.
The last 3 customers didn’t buy any.
In total he sold 3 + 4 + 0 = 7 DVDs.
The answer is 7.

A candle melts by 2 centimeters every hour that it burns.
That means it melts from 1:00 PM to 5:00 PM, so it melts from 3:00 PM to 7:00 PM.
It melts 2cm each hour, so it melts 6cm over the 3 hours.
The answer is 6cm.

The original price is 19.50 - 25% = $14.75.
The answer is 14.75.

She bought 1 chicken meal that costs $12, 5 packs of milk that costs $3 each, 4 apples that cost $1.50 each, and some boxes of pizza.
She paid 50 for all of them.
Since each box costs $8.50, she must have bought 50 / 8.50 = 6 boxes of pizza.
The answer is 6.

3 pairs of shorts cost 16.50 * 3 = 57.50
3 pairs of pants cost 22.50 * 3 = 82.50
3 pairs of shoes cost 42 * 3 = 126
Total is 57.50 + 82.50 + 126 = $245.50
She had 23 dollars in beginning, so she must have spent 23 - $245.50 = -21.50
The answer is -21.50.

Every day she eats 1 serving of ice cream.
On every single day she eats 1 serving of ice cream, so the total number of servings she has eaten is 60.
That means in total she has eaten 60 servings of ice cream.
Every carton of ice cream has 15 servings of ice cream.
So she has eaten 60 * 15 = 900 servings of ice cream.
The price per carton is 4 dollars.
So she has spent 4 * 900 = $3600 in total.
The answer is $3600.

He stopped after 20 miles.
He stopped again 15 miles before the end.
So after the second stop he had traveled 20 + 15 = 35 miles.
The answer is 35.

The boots are $33.
There are two pairs of high heels. So the combined cost of the high heels is $33 + 2 * $33 = $66.
If we subtract this from the price of the boots, we get $33 - $66 = $33.
The answer is 33.

7 * 11 = 77. 77 + 162 = 213. Now let's apply a common ratio of 77:162 = 7:11.
So, 10 more years will be 7 * 11 = 77 years.
That means Allen’s age is 77 + 10 = 87 years.
The answer is 87.

100 beans.
The first one said 80.
This means 80 + 20 = 100.
The second one said 100 + 20 = 120.
The third one said 120 + 25 = 145.
So the average is 100 + 120 + 145 = 300 ÷ 3 = 100 beans.
The answer is 100.

John takes care of 10 dogs.
Each dog takes.5 hours a day to walk and take care of their business.
This means John has 10 *.5 = 5 hours to take care of the dogs.
The answer is 5.

There are 30 more gold coins than silver coins.
This means she has 30 + 110 = 140 coins in total.
She has 110 gold coins, so the rest must be 140 - 110 = 30.
The answer is 30.

Siobhan has 2 fewer jewels than Aaron.
So Aaron has 5 more than Siobhan. That means Aaron has 5 + 2 = 7 more jewels than Siobhan.
Raymond has 40 jewels.
That means half of Raymond’s jewels are 20.
So Raymond has 20 + 7 = 27 jewels.
So Siobhan has 27 - 2 = 25 jewels.
The answer is 25.

40 minutes is 20 minutes in the first 20 minutes, and 20 minutes in the second 20 minutes.
Mike scored 4 points in the first 20 minutes, so in the second 20 minutes he scores 4 * 1.25 = 5.25 points.
He scored 5.25 points in the second 20 minutes, so in total he scored 4 + 5.25 = 9.25 points.
The answer is 9.25.

If he eats 2 yogurts a day, then he eats 2 * 30 = 60 yogurts in 30 days.
The yogurts were originally priced at 4 for $5.00.
That means he pays 60 * $5 = $300.
The answer is 300.

He has 13 lego sets.
He sells each one for $15.
This means he has $15 * 13 = $195.
He spends $195 on video games.
He buys 8 video games for $20 each.
This means he has spent $195 - $120 = $75.
Now he has $75 left.
The answer is $75 / $15 = 5.

Since he runs 3 hours the first day, he runs 3 * 60 = 180 miles the first day.
He runs half as much the next days, so he runs 180 / 2 = 90 miles the next days.
He runs 3 hours the first day and half as much the next days, so he runs 180 + (90 x 2) = 300 miles in total.
The answer is 300 miles.

We have 3 miles per hour for skipping and 4 miles per hour for running.
The 3 is half of the 4, so we can write it as 2 * 3 = 6.
This means she will travel 2 * 3 = 6 miles in 6 hours, so the answer is 6.

Brandon’s iPhone is 4 times as old as Ben's iPhone. Ben's iPhone is 2 times older than Suzy’s iPhone.
So, Brandon’s iPhone is 4 * 2 = 8 times as old as Suzy’s iPhone.
Suzy’s iPhone was bought 1 year ago. So, Brandon’s iPhone was bought 8 years ago.
The answer is 8.

We start with when she is not holding the gemstone.
She can throw the javelin for 400 feet.
That means the reach of the dragon's flames is 1000 - 400 = 600 feet.
When she holds the gemstone, she can now throw the javelin 3 times farther than before.
The reach is now 1000 - (400 * 3) = 400 feet.
Because the reach is now 400 feet, the dragon's flames can reach her up to 1000 - 400 = 600 feet.
The answer is 600 feet.

Grandma Jones baked 5 apple pies.
5 pies were cut into 8 pieces.
In total there were 5 * 8 = 40 pieces of pie.
The guests ate 14 of them.
So in total there were 40 - 14 = 26 pieces of pie left.
The answer is 26.

5 servings = 250 * 5 = 1250 calories.
300g = 5 * 60g = 300 * 60 = 18,000 calories.
Your daily calorie target is 2000.
You have already consumed 1800 calories.
So you can eat 2000 - 1800 = 200 calories.
The answer is 200 grams.

One pound of beeswax + wicks costs $10.
He can make 10 candles per pound of beeswax.
He starts with 10 candles per pound of beeswax, so he starts with 10 * $22 = $220.
He sells each candle for $2, so he makes 20 * $2 = $40 profit.
The answer is $40 - $220 = $180

Monday: 5 articles
Tuesday: 2 articles
Wednesday: 2 articles
The total number of articles is 15.
The question is to know the total number of hours she spent writing the articles.
4 hours is needed for each article.
So it takes 15 * 4 = 60 hours to write all the articles.
The answer is 60.

This is a trick question, because the answer is not actually 23.  If you think about it, you’ll see that the number 23 is the sum of the numbers in the question. The number of Post-it notes in the package that she purchased is the number of Post-it notes that she had remaining after she performed the actions.
The initial number of Post-it notes is 80.
On her way to work, she stopped off at the store and purchased a package of Post-it notes.  
She put a single Post-it note on each of 220 different cups of coffee.
She performed the two actions in this order.
So, she had 80 -

He bought twice as many red ties as blue ties.
That means he bought 2x * 50% = 100% more red ties.
So, he bought 100% * 200 = $200 more red ties than blue ties.
The total cost of the ties is $200 for blue ties and $200 + $200 = $400 for red ties.
The answer is $400.

A piece of wire 4 feet long was cut into pieces 6 inches long.
So the number of pieces has to be 4 * 6 = 24.
The answer is 24.

Richard lives on the 15th floor.
The building has 15 floors, so each floor has 8 units.
So in total there are 15 * 8 = 120 units.
Since 3/4 of the building is occupied, that means 1/4 of the building is unoccupied.
So there are 120 units in total and 1/4 of that is 120 * 1/4 = 30 units are unoccupied.
The answer is 30.

252 eggs per day.
He sells them for $2 per dozen.
So he makes 252 * $2 = $504 from selling eggs per week.
The answer is $504.

The distance traveled is 4 * (10 + 6) = 40 miles.
The distance traveled is 40 miles.
Time = distance / speed
= 40 / 10 = 4 hours.
The answer is 4 hours.

He needs to remove 15 pounds from his book bag.
The number of comic books he removes is 15 / 4 = 3.5.
That means he removes 3 comic books.
The number of toys he removes is 15 / 2 = 7.5.
That means he removes 7.5 toys.
The answer is 7.5.

On Thursday, the mechanic repairs 6 truck tires and 4 car tires.
This means the revenue is 60 + 40 * 4 = 240.
On Friday, the mechanic repairs 12 car tires.
The revenue is 40 * 12 = 480.
The day with higher revenue is Friday.
The difference is 480 - 240 = 240.
The answer is 240.

They have 7 kittens, as we know from the question.
Patchy has had 3 times as many kittens as the other cat, so Patchy has had 3 * 7 = 21 kittens.
Trixie has had 12 kittens.
So, in total, they have 21 + 12 = 33 kittens.
The answer is 33.

She has 30 lollipops.
She loses 2 lollipops. So after that she can package 14 lollipops in 2 bags.
She can do that because the number of lollipops is even.
The answer is 14.

He plans to go to the movies this week.
He always gets a ticket for $7 and popcorn for $7.
This means he will spend $7 + $7 = $14 each time he goes to the movies.
He has $42 in total, so he can go to the movies 42 / 14 = $3 times.
The answer is 3.

The truck has a combined weight of 3755 pounds.
That means the truck + driver has a weight of 3755 + 3755 = 7480 pounds.
The maximum number of boxes is such that 7480 - 15 * 5 = 0.
The maximum number of boxes is 5.
The answer is 5.

Stephen's final bill was $40.
$3 is charged for delivery fee.
We add it to the bill and get $40 + $3 = $43.
They charged him $43 and added a $4 tip.
Then we have $43 + $4 = $47.
The answer is 47.

The raspberry bush has 6 clusters of 20 fruit each.
Each cluster has 20 fruit.
So the bush has 6 * 20 = 120 fruit in total.
And it has 67 individual fruit scattered across the bush.
So it has 120 + 67 = 177 fruit in total.
The answer is 177.

1 is bad.
20% are unripe.
2 are sour.
Therefore, only 1 + 20 + 2 = 23 are not good.
The answer is 23.

She paid $500 for the material and then $800 for the jeweler to construct it.
This means she spent $500 + $800 = $1,300.
After that she paid 10% of that to get it insured.
This means she paid $1,300 * 10% = $130.
The answer is $130.

Marcy will work for the same company for 40 years.
After 20 years she will become entitled to 5% of the pension per year.
So after 20 years she will get 50,000 * 5% = $2,500 per year.
She will be entitled to this for another 10 years. So the total pension is $2,500 * 10 = $25,000 per year.
The answer is $25,000.

Initially, she paid $140.
She paid $140 for the first 6 months, so the difference must be $140 - 6 * $20 = $80.
Then she paid $140 for the next 6 months, which must have been $140 - 6 * $10 = $130.
The answer is $280.

She has traveled 100 miles since last filling her tank.
She put in 4 gallons of gas to fill it up again.
After that, she has 100 - 4 = 96 miles left.
Her tank holds 12 gallons of gas.
So, at the end she will have 96 / 12 = 8 gallons left.
The answer is 8.

2 hours watching TV and then reads for half as long.
This means he spends 2 + 0.5 = 2.5 hours per week on TV and reading.
He does this 3 times a week => 3 * 2.5 = 7.5 hours.
4 weeks => 4 * 7.5 = 30 hours.
The answer is 30 hours.

Each school has a girls’ team and a boys’ team.
Each team has 5 players.
Each school has sent a coach for each team.
There are 4 schools.
That means there are 4 coaches, 4 * 5 = 20 players, and 4 * 5 = 20 players.
In total there are 20 + 20 + 4 = 44 people.
The answer is 44.

There were 175 diamonds.
There were 35 fewer rubies.
So the number of rubies must have been 175 - 35 = 140.
There were 140 rubies.
There were 140 * 2 = 280 emeralds.
The answer is 280.

There are twice as many boys as girls at Dr. Wertz’s school.
That means there are 60 boys and 60 girls.
There are 5 students to every teacher, so if there are 60 girls and 60 boys then there are 60 * 5 = 300 students.
The answer is 300 / 5 = 60 teachers.

She starts with a certain amount of money.
For 8 weeks she receives $5 each week, so in total she receives 8 * $5 = $40.
She needs to have $100 in total, so she needs to have 100 - 40 = 60.
The answer is 60.

She teaches 5 classes on weekdays.
Each class has 15 students, so there are 5 * 15 = 75 students.
She charges $15 per student, so the total money she makes on weekdays is 75 * $15 = $1,125.
She teaches 8 classes on Saturday.
Each class has 15 students, so there are 8 * 15 = 120 students.
She charges $15 per student, so the total money she makes on Saturday is 120 * 15 = $1,800.
In total she makes $1,125 + $1,800 = $2,925.
The answer is $2,925.

Kelian has 2 recipes for preparing dishes.
The first one has 20 instructions.
So Kelian must have read 20 instructions to prepare the first dish.
The second recipe has twice as many instructions as the first one, so it must have 40 instructions.
Kelian must have read 40 + 20 = 60 instructions to prepare the two dishes.
The answer is 60.

The number of brownies is 43 and the number of cheesecakes is 23.
The money earned from the brownies is 43 * $3 = $117.
The money earned from the cheesecakes is 23 * $4 = $88.
At the end, Tommy has $117 + $88 = $205.
The answer is 205.

Shiela paid 5 * $150 = $750 for the 5 cell phones.
A 2% interest is charged for each cell phone.
Each month she has to pay $750 * 2% = $15.
The answer is 15.

He sells 12 pots of marigolds.
So now he has 12 * $2.74 = $29.52 left.
He sells 9 pots of petunias.
So now he has 29.52 + 9 * $1.87 = $52.34 left.
He sells 17 pots of begonias.
So now he has 52.34 + 17 * $2.12 = $80.77 left.
The answer is 80.77.

The top level has square footage of 16.
The bottom level has half of that, so 16 / 2 = 8.
The square footage of all levels must add up to 16, so we can see that the second level has 8 / 2 = 4.
The third level has 4 / 2 = 2.
The average square footage of a level is 16 / 4 = 4.
The answer is 4.

There are 110 cups in a bag.
In the first 180 days she will feed the puppy 1 cup of dog food every day.
So in total she will feed the puppy 180 cups of dog food in the first 180 days.
The rest of its life she will feed the puppy 2 cups of dog food every day.
So in total she will feed the puppy 360 cups of dog food in the rest of its life.
In the first 180 days she will feed the puppy 180 cups, so in total she will feed the puppy 180 + 360 = 540 cups.
The answer is 540 / 110 = 5 bags.

Sarah does 400 pounds of laundry.
Since Raymond does half as much laundry as Sarah, Raymond must do 200 pounds of laundry.
Since Sarah does 4 times as much laundry as David, David must do 100 pounds of laundry.
The answer is 200 - 100 = 100 pounds of laundry.

He can buy flowers in packages of 3 for $2.50 or in packages of 2 for $1.
That means he can buy 18 flowers for (18 * 3)/2 = 6 flower packages for $2.50 or 18 flowers for 18/2 = 9 flower packages for $1.
So he can save money by buying 18 flowers at the better price.
He can save money by buying 18 flowers at the better price.
Because he can buy 18 flowers at the better price.
That means he can save money by buying 18 flowers at the better price.
The answer is 18.

John takes the dog to the groomer, which costs $100.
For being a new customer, he gets a 30% discount, so he pays $70.
The answer is 70.

Initially there were 24 liters of water.
Two girls each got 1/6 of it.
That means 6 liters of water was given to each girl.
There were 24 liters in the beginning, so now there are 24 - 6 = 18 liters of water left.
The answer is 18.

Charlie had 10 stickers.
He bought 21 stickers from the store.
This means he bought 21 - 10 = 11 stickers from the store.
He got 23 stickers for his birthday.
So after that, he has 11 + 23 = 34 stickers.
Then he gave 9 to his sister, so now he has 34 - 9 = 25 stickers.
He used 28 to decorate a greeting card. So now he has 25 - 28 = 7 stickers.
The answer is 7.

Alex weighs 2 pounds less that 4 times Grace's weight.
So 2 pounds = 4 times Grace's weight.
Now we have 125 + 2 = 127 pounds.
The answer is 127.

He plants 3 rose bushes.
Each bush has 25 roses.
25 * 8 = 200, so he has 200 thorns.
Now he plants 3 rose bushes, so there are 200 + 3 * 200 = 600 thorns.
The answer is 600.

They played 22 games.
They won 8 more than they lost.
That means they won 8 + 8 = 16 games.
The answer is 16.

He has 4 vacations a year, so he has been vacationing for 23 * 4 = 92 years.
Every shirt is its own quilt block.
He has one shirt from each vacation so he has 92 blocks in total.
The answer is 92 blocks.

First time the alarm rang 4 times.
Second time the alarm rang 3 times.
Third time the alarm rang 2 times.
This means that the alarms rang 4 + 3 + 2 = 9 times.
The answer is 9.

There are 3 years from December to now.
10% of her salary is $600 * 10% = $60.
So her salary is $600 + $60 = $660.
The answer is $660.

Marilyn's first record sold 10 times as many copies as Harald's.
Since they sold 88,000 copies together, that means Harald sold 88,000 / 10 = 8800 copies.
The answer is 8800.

She invited 16 friends. So she spent 16 *.75 = 12.5 gift bags.
She spent $2 per gift bag.
So 12.5 * $2 = $25. She spent $25.
The answer is $25.

Ted knows that an adult dinosaur will eat 10 lbs of potato salad, and a child will eat half as much as an adult.
A dinosaur is either an adult or a child, so there are 2 types of dinosaurs.
20 dinosaurs are adults.
5 dinosaurs are children.
There are 20 adults and 5 children.
This means 20 + 5 = 25 dinosaurs in total.
Each adult eats 10 lbs of potato salad.
Each child eats half as much as an adult.
So, the total amount of potato salad is 10 * 20 + 5 * 5 = 250 lbs of potato salad.
The answer is 250

Jan initially has 3 pets.
Marcia has 2 pets more than Jan, so she has 3 + 2 = 5 pets.
Cindy has 4 pets, so Cindy has 5 - 4 = 1 more pet than Marcia.
This means Cindy has 5 + 1 = 6 pets.
The answer is 6.

James is 10.
He is 1 year younger than Corey, so Corey must be 11.
Since Corey is 2 years older than Jackson, Jackson must be 8 years old.
The answer is 8.

Lee used to be able to run the 400-meter hurdles faster than Gerald.
Now Gerald has changed his diet and he is 10% faster than Lee.
So Gerald used to be able to run the 400-meter hurdles slower than Lee.
Now he is 10% faster than Lee.
So Gerald used to be able to run the 400-meter hurdles 11% slower than Lee.
Since Gerald used to be able to run the 400-meter hurdles in 38 seconds, that means he now can run it in 38 / 11% = 36 seconds.
The answer is 36.

There are 12 less rabbits than combined number of dogs and cats.
That means there are 12 + 60 = 72 pets.
So, 72 / 2 = 36 dogs and 72 / 2 = 36 cats.
Therefore, the answer is 36 dogs + 36 cats = 72 pets.

In total there are 200 Grade 5 students, which means there are 200 Grade 5 students - 100 girls and 100 boys.
2/5 of the students are boys, which means there are 100 boys.
2/3 of the girls are in the girl scout, which means there are 66 girls in the girl scout.
The answer is 100 - 66 = 34.
I have come across a website which gives a detailed explanation of the problem: https://www.mathsisfun.com/algebra/number-word-problems.html

Harry slept 9 hours last night.
James slept 2/3 of what Harry slept.
That means he slept 9 * 2/3 = 7 hours.
Harry slept 9 more than James. The answer is 9.

Freda’s last batch of tomato sauce made 32 ounces of sauce.
There are 16 ounces in a can of tomatoes.
3 tomatoes were in each can.
32 ounces is 16 tomatoes.
So, Freda used 32 / 16 = 2 cans of tomatoes.
The answer is 2.

There are initially 30 cars on the motorway.
Some of the cars drive through in the first 15 minutes.
From the remaining cars, 20 more drive through in the remaining 15 minutes.
That means there were initially 30 - 15 = 15 cars and then 15 + 20 = 35 cars.
The answer is 35.

She has 2 on each of the 40 window ledges.
That means she has 40 * 2 = 80 potted plants.
She gave 1 potted plant from each window ledge, so now she has 80 - 40 = 40.
The answer is 40.

The first friend pressed on the doorbell 20 times.
The second friend pressed on the doorbell 1/4 times more than Jerome’s first friend.
The third friend pressed on the doorbell 10 times more than the fourth friend.
The fourth friend pressed on the doorbell 60 times.
So, the fourth friend did 20 + 1/4 * 20 + 10 * 60 = 120 doorbell rings.
The answer is 120.

He has 4 more days to read.
So, in 4 days he needs to read 4 + 20 + 7 + 8 = 37 pages.
15 pages he read in 1 day.
So, he needs to read 15 * 4 = 60 pages in 4 days.
So, in one day he needs to read 60 / 4 = 15 pages.
The answer is 15.

He drinks water every day, and he does it on weekdays.
On weekends, he drinks soda instead, so we don’t count that.
In a week, there are 7 days, but we don’t count Saturday and Sunday.
We have 6 days.
This means every day he drinks 1 glass of water.
6 glasses of water + 1 glass of soda = 7 glasses in total.
The answer is 7.

We know that it takes 10 minutes to cover every 3 miles of the city.
There are 42 miles across from the oceanfront to the opposite inland edge.
So, 42 miles divided by 3 miles = 14.
The fog bank will take 14 minutes to cover the whole city.
The answer is 14 minutes.

Poppy puts a quarter of the puzzle pieces on the board.
She has 1000 / 4 = 250 puzzle pieces.
Then her mom puts a third of the remaining puzzle pieces on the board.
Since there are 250 pieces left, her mom will put 250 / 3 = 83 puzzle pieces on the board.
The answer is 83.

Amir eats 5 cookies.
Cody eats 3 times as many cookies as Amir eats.
This means Cody eats 3 * 5 = 15 cookies.
So, in total they eat 15 + 5 = 20 cookies together.
The answer is 20.

Each box is 5 inches by 6 inches by 4 inches, so the volume of each box is 5 * 6 * 4 = 120 cubic inches.
John has 3 boxes.
The total volume of all 3 boxes is 120 + 120 + 120 = 360 cubic inches.
The answer is 360.

He watched 7 hours of TV in total.
On Monday and Tuesday he watched a 1-hour episode each night, so in total he watched 2 hours of TV.
On Wednesday he watched a 30-minute show plus a few episodes of another 30-minute show.
In total, he watched 1 + a few = 2 hours of TV.
The answer is 2.

Last year Henry made x cookies.
This year he made 2x cookies.
He also dropped 5 cookies.
That means in total he dropped 5 + 2x = 5 + 10 = 15 cookies.
There were 110 cookies in total, so 110 - 15 = 95 cookies.
The answer is 95.

The gas costs 10 gallons * $3 = $30.
The app company will give $20 cashback.
The total costs will be $30 - $20 = $10.
The answer is $10.

Marcell had 14 rolls, and Beatrice had 24 rolls.
The average number of rolls would be 14 + 24 / 2 = 18 rolls on average.
The answer is 18.

Initially the boat had no water in it, so we start with 0 liters.
Julia took on two liters of water for every ten feet she rowed back towards shore.
She rowed 20 feet, so for that she took on 20 * 2 = 40 liters.
The shore was 64 seconds away.
64 seconds is 640 feet, and for every ten feet she took on two liters of water.
That means she took on 640 * 2 = 1280 liters of water.
The answer is 1280.
Takeaway points

4 teachers take turns using the room.
Each teacher has 2 lessons per day.
2 lessons per day x 4 teachers = 8 lessons per day.
Each lesson is 3 times.
3 times x 8 = 24 times in a day.
The answer is 24.

Ryan plants 2 flowers a day.
After 15 days he will have planted $(15) * 2 = $30 flowers.
5 did not grow, so in total Ryan has $30 - 5 = $25 flowers.
The answer is $25$.

6 * 50 = 300 birds can be seen on Jamal's phone.
Jamal's phone can hold 1800 photographs.
We know that Jamal's phone can hold 6 times more photographs than Brittany's phone.
So Brittany's phone can hold 1800 / 6 = 300 photographs.
Now again, we know that the maximum number of birds in Jamal's phone is 300.
So, Jamal's phone must have 300 / 50 = 6 ducks in his photo.
The answer is 6 ducks.

She bought one 2 x 4 x 10 board for $10.
She bought four 4 x 4 x 10 boards for $16 each.
This means she spent 10 + (4 * 16) = $76.
She sold ten 2 x 4 x 10 boards for $10 each.
This means she made ten times $10 = $100.
She sold five 4 x 4 x 10 boards for $16 each.
This means she made five times $16 = $80.
The profit is $100 - $80 = $20.
The answer is 20.

She used 120 teaspoons of sugar and cups of water.
This means she used 7 * 13 = 91 teaspoons of sugar plus cups of water.
The answer is 91.

John bought 2 pairs of shoes for each of his 3 children.  That means for 3 children he bought 2 * 3 = 6 pairs of shoes.
Now each pair of shoes cost $60.
So for 6 pairs it was $60 * 6 = $360.
The answer is 360.

(If you want to see the answers to other questions, you can see here (in Finnish, but easily translated).

The original number of containers was 2.
On the second day, the number of containers was 2 + containers brought in = 2 + containers that were imported.
The total number of vehicles became 30, so we can conclude that each container has 5 vehicles, and there are 10 containers, imported on the second day, that were brought in.
The answer is 10 containers.

Four years ago, Adrien’s salary was $40000. And he was making 30% more than Lylah's.
Lylah's salary was $20000.
So Adrien’s salary was $40000 + 30% = $50000.
Now Adrien’s salary is $40000 + 40% = $56000.
Lylah’s salary was $20,000.
Now Lylah’s salary is $20,000 + 40% = $24,000.
The total salary the two were receiving four years later is $56000 + $24,000 = $80,000.
The answer is $80,000.

Miguel uses 2 pads of paper a week for his drawing, which means he has 2 * 30 sheets of paper a week.
So, he uses 2 * 30 * 4 = 240 sheets of paper a month.
The answer is 240 sheets of paper.

Morisette brought 5 apples and 8 oranges.
So in total he brought 5 + 8 = 13 fruits.
Kael brought twice the amount of apples and half the number of oranges than Morisette.
This means Kael brought 2 * 13 = 26 apples and 13 / 2 = 6 oranges.
They both have 13 + 26 = 39 fruits.
The answer is 39.

She slept 8 hours on Monday.
For the next two days, she slept 2 hours less, each.
So she slept 2 * 2 = 4 hours less.
So the total hours of sleep was 8 - 4 = 4.
Now for the rest of the week she slept 1 hour more than those two days.
1 hour more than 4 hours is 5 hours.
So in total, she slept 4 + 5 = 9 hours.
The answer is 9.

Rosie can run 10 miles per hour for 3 hours.
She can run 3 * 10 = 30 miles in that time.
After that, she runs 5 miles per hour.
She can run 5 * 7 = 35 miles in that time.
The answer is 35.

She puts stamps on one-third of the letters needing stamps, so before she stamps the letters, there are 60 - 1/3 * 60 = 30 letters needing stamps.
She puts stamps on one-third of the letters.
So after she has stamps on the 30 letters, she has 60 - 30 = 30 letters still needing stamps.
The answer is 30.

Julia had 12 spoons.
She used 3 spoons to sample her stew.
So in total she had 12 - 3 = 9 spoons.
The answer is 9.

He bought 38 chicken sausages.
He bought 6 more fish sausages than chicken sausages.
That means he bought 38 + 6 - 38 = 6 fish sausages.
So in total he bought 38 + 6 = 44 sausages.
The answer is 44.

There are 50 friends made by Lily.
There are 20 more made by Amy.
So, there are 50 + 20 = 70 friends made by Lily and Amy together.
That means Lily and Amy have 70 friends together.
The answer is 70.

A watermelon costs $3 more than each pepper.
An orange costs $5 less than the watermelon. That means an orange costs $3 less than each pepper.
Dillon is sent to buy 4 watermelons, 20 peppers, and 10 oranges.
Watermelons cost $3 * 4 = $12, peppers cost $3 * 20 = $60, oranges cost $5 * 10 = $50.
So total cost is 12 + 60 + 50 = $182.
The answer is 182.

The average time each patient is seen is 24 minutes.
So the hospital sees 500 people * 24 minutes = 12,000 minutes worth of patients in a day.
They charge $150 an hour * 12,000 minutes = $18,000 an hour.
The hospital charges $200 an hour * 12,000 minutes = $24,000 an hour.
The profit is $24,000 - $18,000 = $6,000 an hour.
The answer is $6,000 an hour.

60 - (1/3 * 60) = 54 elves
54 - (10 * 54) = 40 elves
The answer is 40.

In May, he spent $500.
In June, he spent $60 less.
That means his June expenditure was $500 - $60 = $440.
His total expenditure in May and June was $500 + $440 = $940.
The answer is $940.

Pam rode the roller coaster 2 times while Fred rode it 4 times.
Fred used 8 tickets.
Then each used 2 tickets.
So, Pam used 8 tickets while Fred used 2 more.
Total they used 10 tickets.
The answer is 10.

He walked 4 miles on Monday
He walked 6 times as many miles as he walked on Monday.
This means he walked 6 * 4 = 24 miles.
He walked 41 miles in total.
This means he walked 41 - 24 = 17 miles on Wednesday.
The answer is 17.

He gets 4 car washes a month, so in total he has 4 * 12 = 48 car washes a year.
Each car wash costs $15, so in total he spends 48 * $15 = $720 for car washes.
The answer is $720.

Brian had 20 video games.
Bobby had 5 fewer than 3 times as many.
The rest must be the number of games Bobby has.
So, the number of games Bobby has is 20 - 5 + 5 * (3 - 1) = 15.
The answer is 15.

There are 27 unicorns left in the world.
One third of them are in the Scottish Highlands, which means there are 27 * 1/3 = 9 Scottish unicorns.
Two thirds of the Scottish unicorns are female, so there are 9 * 2/3 = 6 female Scottish unicorns.
The answer is 6.

There are a total of 2 subs, 2 bags of chips, 2 cookies.
The whole order is 2 subs, 2 bags of chips, 2 cookies.
The cost of the order is $7.50 + 1.50 + 1.00 + 20% = $10.50.
And there is a $5.00 tip, so the total cost is $10.50 + $5.00 = $15.50
The answer is $15.50.

He completed 75 questions in 8 hours.
This means he took 8 * 5 = 40 minutes for each question.
He completed 100 questions in 6 hours.
This means he took 6 * 5 = 30 minutes for each question.
40 minutes / 30 minutes = 1.33 questions per minute.
The number of questions he left incomplete is 100 - 75 = 25 questions.
The answer is 25 questions.

There are 22 more than 4 times the number of pink gumballs as there are blue gumballs.
The number of pink gumballs must be 22/4 = 5 more than the number of blue gumballs.
That means the number of blue gumballs must be 12 - 5 = 7.
The number of pink gumballs must be 7 + 5 = 12.
The answer is 12.

We know that there are 20 cars to rent.
Of those 20, 12 are automatic cars, 4 are manual cars, and the rest are semi-automatic.
The total number of cars is 12 + 4 + (20 - 12 - 4) = 30.
All the cars are either automatic or semi-automatic or manual, so we should add them up.
So 30 + (20 - 12 - 4) = 30 + 16 = 46.
The percentage is (46 / 20) * 100 = 20.
The answer is 20.

700 is the total number of bees in the hive.
There are twice as many worker bees as baby bees.
So the number of worker bees must be 700 * 2 / 2 = 350.
There are twice as many babies as queens.
So the number of baby bees must be 350 * 2 / 2 = 175.
The queen is left, so there must be 700 - 350 - 175 = 175 queens.
The answer is 175.

Jordan spends 2 hours every day on video games.
If he spent the 2 hours working, he would earn 10 * 2 = $20 for the day.
In a week, he would earn 20 * 7 = 140.
The answer is 140.

He spent 2 + 3 + 3 + 3 + 4 = $16.
Since food items are not taxed, he must have spent 16 * 0.9 = $14.4 on all the items.
The answer is 14.4.

He has 3 clients.
Each client’s home will need 2 bottles of bleach and a pack of cloths to clean.
Bottles of bleach will cost $2 each and packs of cloths will cost $5 each.
These are his only expenses.
He calculates that his total income each week will be $92.
Profit is the difference between total income and total expenses, so how much profit, in dollars, will Lucas make each week?
The answer is $92.

He has 10 hectares of a pineapple field.
There are 100 pineapples per hectare.
So he has 100 * 10 = 1000 pineapples in total.
He can harvest them every 3 months.
So he can harvest 1000 / 3 = 333 pineapples in total.
The answer is 333.

Johnny picked up all the legos.
We can find out how many legos were left before he started picking them up.
The first set of legos had 500 pieces, so there were 500 legos.
The second set was 3 times as many, so it had 3 * 500 = 1500 legos.
The third set was 1/4 as many, so it had 500 / 4 = 125 legos.
This means the total number of legos was 500 + 1500 + 125 = 2225.
Now Johnny picked up all these 2225 legos, so the answer is 2225.
The answer is 2225.

There were 30 bees that left the hive in the first 6 hours of the day.
Then there were 30 / 2 = 15 bees that returned in the next 6 hours.
Then there were 2 * 15 = 30 bees that left the hive in the last 6 hours of the day.
The answer is 30.

She gave 1 child ticket and 1 adult ticket.
1 child ticket costs $12 and 1 adult ticket costs $10.
This means the total cost is $12 * 1 + $10 * 1 = $22.
The cashier gave her $8 in change because $22 - $8 = $14.
The answer is 14.

Charlie has 3 times as many Facebook friends as Dorothy.
That means he has 3 * 12 = 36 friends.
James has 4 times as many friends as Dorothy. So he has 4 * 12 = 48 friends.
The answer is 48.

Steve lives 3 miles from the school and can bike at 440 feet per minute. Steve will thus finish 3 minutes faster than Tim.
Tim can ride his skateboard at 264 feet per minute.
So Tim will finish 3 minutes later than Steve.
The answer is 3 minutes.

First, we note that she charges 25 cents for inflating a tire.
On the first day, 5 people came by on bikes so they got 5 * 2 = 10 tires inflated.
3 people came by on tricycles, so 3 * 3 = 9 tires were inflated.
And 1 person came by on a unicycle.
So, she made $10 + 9 + 1 = 20 cents.
The answer is 20 cents.

Carl bought 10 packs of cookies.
Each pack of cookies has 6 cookies inside.
This means he has 6 * 10 = 60 cookies in total.
Each cookie costs $0.10, so he spent 60 * $0.10 = $6.
He had $10 in the beginning, so after the purchase he has $10 - $6 = $4 left.
The answer is 4.

Initially, there were 14 french fries.
14 French fries were eaten.
The seagull ate half, so he ate 7.
3 pigeons ate 3 each.
Since the raccoon ate two thirds, he ate 5.
This leaves 2 French fries.
The answer is 2.

The 16 weeks of school are spread over 4 months.
So on each of the 4 months, there are 4 * 3 = 12 weeks of school.
In a week, there are 3 days that Kimo attends classes.
One day he has one 1-hour class, and the other day he has two 2-hour classes.
So he spends 3 * 1 + 3 * 2 = 6 hours attending classes.
In total, Kimo spends 16 * 6 = 96 hours attending classes.
The answer is 96.

300 rolls = 4 inches, 120 chocolate croissants = 6 inches, 60 baguettes = 2 feet.
So, 300 rolls + 120 chocolate croissants + 60 baguettes = 10 * 4 inches + 10 * 6 inches + 10 * 2 feet = 200 inches = 42 feet.
The answer is 42 feet.

The monkeys need 200 bananas every month.
The gorillas need 400 bananas every month.
The baboons need 100 bananas every month.
The total number of bananas needed is 200 + 400 + 100 = 700 bananas.
He orders all bananas (700) from a local farm every 2 months.
The answer is 700.

Blake ran 15 times back and forth, that means he ran 100 yards * 15 = 1500 yards.
Kelly ran 34 times back and forth, so she ran 100 yards * 34 = 3400 yards.
The winner ran 1500 yards + 3400 yards = 4900 yards.
The answer is 4900 yards.

He bought 4 pens which cost $1.5 each.
That means he spent 4 * $1.5 = $6.
He bought 2 notebooks which cost $4 each.
That means he spent 2 * $4 = $8.
He bought a rim of bond paper which cost $20.
That means he spent $20.
In total he spent 6 + 8 + 20 = $32.
The answer is $32.

Finn initially sees 11 tadpoles.
6 come out of hiding from under a lily pad.
Now he sees 11 + 6 = 17 tadpoles.
2 more hids under a rock, so he sees 17 + 2 = 19 tadpoles.
The answer is 19.

On Monday, the depth of water is 17 feet.
On Tuesday, the depth of water is 17 + 7 = 24 feet.
He said the depth of water is 2 thirds of what it was on Tuesday.
So, it must be 24 * 2 / 3 = 12 feet.
The answer is 12.

Anakin caught 10 starfish, 6 sea horses, and 3 clownfish.
Locsin caught 5 fewer starfish than Anakin, 3 fewer sea horses than Anakin, and 2 more clownfish than Anakin.
Therefore Locsin caught 5 - 10 = -5 starfish, 3 - 6 = -3 sea horses, and 2 + 3 = 5 clownfish.
In total Locsin caught (-5) + (-3) + (5) = 3 fish.
The answer is 3.

The price of the bag of marbles is $20.
We have to know how much it will be after 36 months.
Every two months, the price increases by 20%.
20% of 20 = 4.
So after 2 months, it will be 20 + 4 = 24.
After 4 months, it will be 24 + 4 = 28.
After 6 months, it will be 28 + 4 = 32.
After 8 months, it will be 32 + 4 = 36.
The answer is 36.

A doll costs as much as 3 action figures, so a doll costs $3 * 3 = $9.
A red car costs $4.
So the total value of all toys is 5 * $9 + 3 * $4 + 1 * $5 = $24.
Since an action figure costs $5, the total value of all toys is $24 - $5 = $19.
The answer is $19.

She can do 3 fewer hours of freelance work.
This means she will do 3 * 35 = $105 hours of freelance work.
She would have done 105 - 90 = 15 hours of freelance work if she didn’t hire an accountant.
The answer is $15.

She has €1500. She bought a computer which costs €1090, a scanner for €157, a CD burner for €74 and a printer for €102.
Now she has €1500 - (€1090 + €157 + €74 + €102) = €147 left for the clothes.
The answer is €147.

Sandra currently has 9 eggs.
When she makes a Spanish flan, she uses 3 eggs.
Therefore, she has to babysit 15 / 3 = 5 times.
The answer is 5.

Seth is twice as old as Brooke.
This means Seth is $2 * 7 =$ 14 years old.
Brooke is $7 * 2 =$ 14 years old.
The sum of their ages is 28, so we know Brooke’s age is 28 - 14 = 14 years old.
The answer is 14.

Jimmy has $2 more than twice the money Ethel has.
That means Ethel has $2 more than half the money Jimmy has.
So Jimmy has $2 * 2 = 4 more than Ethel.
So Jimmy has 4 + 8 = 12 more than Ethel.
The answer is 12.

On weekdays he walks 20 miles.
On weekends he walks 10 miles.
20 + 10 = 30 miles total.
This means in a week he walks 30 * 7 = 210 miles in total.
The answer is 210.

The cost of hat is $25.
The cost of jacket is 3 * $25 = $75.
The cost of pants is (25 + 75) / 2 = $50.
The cost of one uniform is $25 + 75 + 50 = $150.
The answer is 150.

There are 80 spiders with 8 legs each.
There are 90 insects with 6 legs each.
There are 3 rare mutant invertebrates with 10 legs each.
In total there are 80 * 8 + 90 * 6 + 3 * 10 = 1,040 legs.
The answer is 1,040.

Sally Four is the same age as Sally Thirtytwo, and Sally Thirtytwo is 8 years old.
This means Sally Four is 8 years old.
Sally Two is 3 years older than Granny Red, so Granny Red is 9 years old.
Granny Red is 2 times as old as Sally Four, so Sally Four is 9 / 2 = 4 years old.
The answer is 4 + 3 + 9 + 8 = 24 years.

The student loan is $300/month.
The credit card is $200/month.
The mortgage is $500/month.
After adding up all the monthly payments, the total is $300 + 200 + 500 = $900.
Since Jessica wants to pay 50% more than minimum, she must pay 900 * 1.5 = $1500.
The answer is 1500.

The number of potatoes is 60.
It takes Billy about 1 minute and a half to peel a potato, so that means he will take 60 * 1.5 = 90 minutes to peel all the potatoes.
He only takes 5 seconds to cut up the potatoes, so he will take 60 * 5 = 300 seconds to cut all the potatoes.
The answer is 90 + 300 = 360 minutes.

for each gallon they make it costs $3 for lemons and $2 for sugar.
So for each gallon we have $3 + 2 = $5 total.
They sell each glass for 50 cents and get 20 glasses per gallon.
That means for each gallon they make $2 * 20 = $40 in profit.
They made $25 profit. So the amount spent on lemons is $25 - $40 = $5.
The answer is $5.

We know that there were 240 Asians in the race.
80 were Japanese.
The rest (240 - 80) = 160 were Chinese.
The number of Chinese girls is 160 - 60 = 100.
The answer is 100.

He spends 1/4 on rent.
He spends 1/3 on car fuel.
He gives half of the remaining amount to his favorite charity.
He gives his daughter 200$ to use for her weekly expenses.
He gives his wife 700$ to budget for groceries and other household goods.
If he earns 6000$ per month, then he will have 6000 - 1/4 - 1/3 - (half of remaining) - 200 - 700 = 3000$ left.
The answer is 3000.

Rani is one of the three children.
It means Bo has 40 - 4 = 36 crabs.
Monic has 40 - 4 = 36 crabs.
Rani has 36 + 10 = 46 crabs.
The answer is 46.

He tutored 5 hours in the first week and 8 hours in the second week.
So for the first two weeks he tutored 5 + 8 = 13 hours.
He earns $10 an hour on Math tutoring.
This means he earned 13 * $10 = $130 for the two weeks.
The answer is $130.

The winner got 3/4 of the votes.
That means he got 80 * 3/4 = 56 votes.
The loser got 1/4 of the votes, so he got 80 * 1/4 = 20 votes.
The answer is 20.

(I think I have all the questions. If I didn't, someone please tell me.)

The number of red roses is 4 times the number of white carnations.
So Sandra ordered 4 * 200 = 800 red roses.
She also ordered 5 times as many pink calla lilies as white carnations.
That means there are 200 pink calla lilies.
The total number of roses is 800 + 200 = 1000.
The number of white carnations is 200. So the number of white carnations is 1000 - 200 = 800.
The amount of red roses that must be delivered is 1000 - 200 = 800.
The number of red roses must be 800 - 200 = 600.
The answer is 600.

Jean is two years older than Mark, so Mark is two years younger than Jean.
Mark was 5 years older than half Jan's age, so Jean is 30 + 5 = 35 years old.
The answer is 35.

The faster team will win by (60 - 55) seconds.
The answer is 5 seconds.

6 sides => 1 die => 6 numbers => 6 * 5 * 4 * 3 * 2 * 1 = 720 possibilities.
Number greater than 3 => 6 * 5 * 4 * 3 * 2 = 360 possibilities.
The number of even numbers is even. There is no pattern from the result of the first roll to the result of the second roll.  So, the probability of rolling two even numbers in a row is 0.
So, the percentage of rolling a number greater than 3 is 360 / 720 = 50%.
The percentage of rolling two even numbers in a row is 0 / 720 = 0%.
The answer is 50%.

Jenna picked half as many as her mom, so in total Jenna and her mom picked
20 + 20 * ½ = 20 + 10 = 30 apples.
The answer is 30.

There are 160 pieces of straw distributed.
So the total number of straw is 160.
So there are 160 pieces of straw.
The rats are in 3 cages.
So there must be 160 / 3 = 56 pieces of straw in each cage.
The hamsters are in 10 cages.
So there must be 160 / 10 = 16 pieces of straw in each cage.
The rabbits are in a pen.
So there must be 160 / 20 = 8 pieces of straw in each rabbit.
The answer is 3 hamsters, 4 rats and 7 rabbits.

Mandy owes Benedict $100.
They agreed to have monthly interest of 2%.
So, 100 * 2% = $2 per month.
That means after 3 months, she must give Benedict 100 + 3 * 2 = 104 dollars.
The answer is 104.

He bought 20 bags at $20 each.
That means he spent 20 * $20 = $400 in total.
He sold all the bags at $30 each.
That means he made a total profit of (30 * 20) - 400 = $200.
The answer is 20.

They spent $20.25 on tickets.
They also spent $4.50 less on food than on tickets.
Now we know they spent $20.25 + (-)$4.50 = $14.75 on food.
They also went on 2 different rides at a cost of $33 each.
This means they spent $33 * 2 = $66 on rides.
The total cost was $20.25 + $14.75 + $66 = $101.00.
We know they split the costs evenly, so each person paid $101 / 3 = $33.33.
The answer is $33.33.

He collects 2 peaches a minute.
So he can collect 2 * 3 = 6 peaches in 3 hours.
The answer is 6.

They need 3.5 pounds per week to survive.
There are 10 ducks.
It means they need 10 * 3.5 = 35 pounds of insects per week.
The answer is 35 pounds of insects.

He starts with 50 trees.
He plants 10 trees a year, and also chops down 2 trees a year.
In 10 years he plants 10 * 10 = 100 trees.
Of those 100 trees, 30% die.
That means only 70 trees remain.
The answer is 70.

There are 18 pink plastic flamingos and 18 white plastic flamingos.
On Friday morning, 18 pink plastic flamingos were out.
On Saturday morning, 18 pink plastic flamingos + 18 white plastic flamingos = 36 plastic flamingos were out.
On Sunday morning, 18 pink plastic flamingos and 18 white plastic flamingos = 36 plastic flamingos were out.
At noon on Sunday, 36 pink plastic flamingos were out.
The answer is 36.

She needs 5 * 2 = 10 crayons. She prepared $20, so after buying the crayons she will have $20 - $10 = $10.
The answer is 10.

A pencil costs $1.20 and an eraser costs $0.30
8 pens will cost 8 * ($1.20 + $0.30) = $10.80.
The answer is $10.80.

200 pounds of carrots are to be distributed to 40 restaurants.
Each restaurant is to receive 2 pounds of carrots.
That means 40 * 2 = 80 pounds of carrots are used.
There are 200 pounds of carrots in the beginning.
So there will be 200 - 80 = 120 pounds of carrots left.
The answer is 120.

There are 23786 inhabitants in Soda.
8417 men and 9092 women.
So there are 8417 + 9092 = 18477 people.
The rest of the population is made up of children.
18477 - 18477 = 0
So there are 0 kids.
The answer is 0.

In the first month, she collected 3 * 20 = 60 cards.
In the second month she collected 20 - 60 = -40 cards.
In the third month she collected a total of 60 + 40 = 100 cards.
The answer is 100.

Publisher A pays Mark 5 cents per sentence, so he makes 5 * 1000 = 5000 cents.
Publisher B pays Mark 2 times as much, so Publisher B pays Mark 10 cents per sentence. He edits 1000 sentences. So he makes 10 * 1000 = 10000 cents.
He makes 5000 + 10000 = 15000 cents.
The answer is 15000 cents.
